Bio: Fund artists and practitioners of any age who are at the early stage of their career.
There is $1.25 million available through each funding round of the Creative Fellowship Fund in 2025 between our General arts, Ngā toi Māori, and Pacific arts funding pools.
There is $1.25 million available through each funding round of the Creative Impact Fund in 2025 between our General arts, Ngā toi Māori, and Pacific arts funding pools.
There are two funding pathways that are open all year, and that you can apply for online at any time, as well as specific funds available for fixed periods.
Fund movements, collectives, community groups and organisations led by people 16 - 35.
An expert in youth development, Youthtown is ideally positioned to ensure that gaming funds are distributed wisely and where they will make a significant and notable contribution.
Spark Foundation allocates around $1.6m per year to organisations and projects that accelerate Digital Equity, with a focus on the next generation of digitech thinkers and creators.
Improving intergenerational wellbeing by supporting tamariki/children, rangatahi/young people and whānau/families to thrive now and into the future.
Work alongside communities to support them to be empowered, inclusive and to lead positive change
Support connected approaches that mitigate climate change, enhance biodiversity, and address equitable adaptation and a transition to a net zero economy.
Supports youth to enrich and strengthen the sector through their mahi.
Aim to back youth movements to transform Aotearoa and the world, and nurture cross-movement collaboration, kinship and solidarity
The Foundation considers grant applications from NZ youth players both at club and International level – past grants have included assistance with costs of training camps and overseas play.
Hastings Youth Council is excited to be supporting rangatahi across our district. Funding is available to individuals, groups or Young Enterprise Scheme business groups – we’re backing YOUth.

By helping young people to attend national events and schools, you will ensure more young people will have the opportunity to experience adventure, build resilience and have a positive attitude to the challenges life flings their way.
